name: CLI framework audit
description: CLI framework audit (Feb 2025): Mulch uses Commander v14 + chalk (reference implementation). Seeds, Canopy, Overstory all use custom manual argv parsing with switch statements and local getFlag/hasFlag helpers. All use raw ANSI codes for colors except Mulch which uses chalk. All support --json globally. All store data as JSONL with advisory file locks and atomic writes.

name: CLI command overlap map
description: Shared commands across tools: sync (all 4), prime (all 4), doctor (mulch/seeds/overstory), onboard (mulch/seeds/canopy), status/stats (mulch=status, seeds=stats, overstory=status, canopy=stats). All have --json on every command. Seeds/Canopy/Overstory run TypeScript directly via Bun (no build step). Mulch compiles to dist/ via tsc (Node/npm). Overstory is the only tool with shell completions (bash/zsh/fish).

name: CLI output and error patterns
description: Mulch uses chalk.green for success (✔), chalk.red for errors, process.exitCode=1 (testability). Seeds uses raw ANSI with status icons, process.exit(1). Canopy uses raw ANSI with ExitError class, process.exit(1). Overstory has richest error system (OverstoryError hierarchy with codes: CONFIG_ERROR, AGENT_ERROR, etc.), uses process.exit(1). JSON error shape is { success: false, command, error } in Seeds/Mulch; Overstory adds error code field.

title: CLI alignment strategy
rationale: Mulch is the reference implementation for CLI UX. All tools will adopt Commander for parsing and chalk for output. Seeds and Canopy get big-bang rewrites of CLI layer (business logic untouched). Overstory gets incremental migration due to its 30+ commands. No shared library — each tool is standalone; they just follow the same conventions. Tracked in root .seeds/ as os-eco-ff85 epic.

name: Tool versions and runtimes
description: Versions (Feb 2025): Mulch v0.5.0 (npm, Node >=18, tsc build, published as mulch-cli). Seeds v0.2.0 (Bun >=1.0, runs .ts directly, bin: sd). Canopy v0.1.2 (Bun >=1.0, runs .ts directly, bin: cn). Overstory v0.6.0 (Bun >=1.0, runs .ts directly, bin: overstory). All use Biome for linting except Mulch (tsc --noEmit only). All have scripts/version-bump.ts. VERSION const stored in entry point + package.json.
